m_szDocTitle: Detroit Auto Show Yields Tech News And The GM Bolt EV GM TSLA HMC - Investors.com
m_szDocSumamry: Comment Day one of the North American International Auto Show (NAIAS) in Detroit Monday brought details on General Motors' (NYSE: GM ) 2017 Chevrolet Bolt EV, a 200-mile-range electric car expected to sell for less than $40,000 that could rival Tesla Motors' (NASDAQ: TSLA ) planned Model 3. The 2017 Bolt debut happened last week at the international consumer electronics show CES in Las Vegas. Then at the Detroit show Monday, the Bolt's 60-kilowatt-hour battery pack was revealed. With around 200 miles of range, the Bolt will have less range between recharges than the current base-model Tesla Mo
